p: Carolyn et al. reported a case of acute pneumonitis after silicone injection for gluteal augmentation. The patients presented with haemoptysis, shortness of breath, and acute respiratory failure two days after the silicone injections 11. Her computed tomography (CT) thorax showed predominantly basilar and peripheral GGO and pulmonary nodules bilaterally. She required ECMO and her condition improved with intravenous methylprednisolone 125 mg every 6 h.
